Luke Maze MBA, CSM, SAFe, PMI-RMP
▶IT MANAGEMENT(Department P&L|Scaled Agile|Risk Mitigation) ▶PRODUCT MANAGEMENT(Vision|Roadmap|Quality)
August 29, 2016, Luke was a client of Billy’s

After surviving multiple Fortune 500 “Agile Transformations” over the last decade, I can identify for you the one critical factor for success.  And Billy Whala represents that factor: Professional agile coaching.  Some corporations notoriously throw money at problems, installing for instance enterprise-class software to solve problems.  Other corporations are known to need quantifiable proof before spending a dime.  Neither strategy actually has much impact on success in my experience, only that professional coaches are available to help the teams makes a difference.  Billy has been one of the best that I have come across – he is knowledgeable, personable, and he gets the message across at all levels of the organization!

June 26, 2016, Prabakaran was a client of Billy’s

I had the opportunity of having coached by Billy last week at Tampa. It was 2 days of great learning on practical aspects how to scale agile organization wide. Billy brought in his extensive knowledge and experience in working with several global clients on their Agile transformation journey. He related every topic of the SAFe Training with the real-world client experience and helped us connect our current environment. I was amazed at how he spent time with each one of us to understand our current world and our expectations out of the course and adjusted his training. 2 days of very productive and time well spent. There are several take aways from this session to optimize our current environment.  Thank you Billy for your coaching. Appreciate it

June 22, 2016, Billy worked with Paarul in the same group

Billy was the instructor for my two day SAFe Agilist Training and I must say, he made the complex concepts very easy to follow and relate to. Since Billy has huge hands-on experience implementing SAFe and coaching teams, he was able to go beyond the training material and share many valuable tips and success stories. The sessions were very interactive, included video material and team activities - which constantly kept everyone engaged. As an instructor, I must mention, he does a phenomenal job at conveying his ideas, handling questions, driving discussions, creating an interactive environment, staying poised, making learning fun and keeping a track of time. If there is a SAFe training you are planning for your leaders/teams, I would very strongly recommend having Billy train, coach and mentor.

summary: Productive, efficient, engaging and goal-oriented professional with over 12 years of experience in Project Management, Agile Coaching & Training and Consulting services. Hands-on, roll-up-sleeves approach. Connects with people at all levels, simplifies complex problems, and remains calm in a storm.Extensive experience working with different organizations & work environments. Worked with the Leadership & Management (VPs, Directors, Product Managers, EPMO, etc.) @ the strategy level & with stakeholders (Product Owners, Developers, Testers, Architects, Release Managers, etc.) @ the implementation level. Worked with large number of team members for Product driven software development. Most of the experience is with teams across time zones and countries. Played a pivotal role in setting the stage of the Agile and Lean Transformation strategy, understanding the maturity of the organizations and rolling out the Transformation in phases. The Transformation has included the formation of the strategy, training, coaching, mentoring, implementation and adjustments @ the tactical level. Adept @ fostering collaboration & innovation environment, important ingredients in the Agile Environment. Recognizes people's talents & mentors them into roles where they are able to perform effectively, which thereby helps him to focus on other areas. Train & Mentor teams to continue with progress and continuous improvement.Catalyst for change, recognizes waste and puts processes in place which make systems and people very efficient. Strategy for change is to include and make people as part it, not exclude them.
name: Billy Whala, CSM, CSP, SPC4
